alert.note: Alert for Cedar; Clinton; Jackson; Jones (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 26 at 2:10PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A slow-moving thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Clinton, southwestern Jackson, northern Cedar and eastern Jones Counties through 300 PM CDT... At 209 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a slow-moving thunderstorm over Monmouth, or 14 miles west of Maquoketa. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, minor flooding and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could cause minor tree limb damage and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Slowing or redirecting of traffic due to ponding or flowing water. Closure of waterfront access due to flooding. Locations impacted include... Tipton, Mechanicsville, Stanwood, Olin, Wyoming, Oxford Junction, Onslow, Monmouth, Morley, Center Junction, Canton, Clarence, Baldwin, Emeline, Oxford Mills, Eden Valley Refuge, Maquoketa Caves State Park, Hale, Crab Town, and Scotch Grove. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Stay away from flooded areas. Report any flooding to local law enforecement. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. If the heavy rain continues, a flash flood warning may be needed.
